intro: Cistus × cyprius f. pictus, commonly known as the painted rock rose, is a hybrid shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage, which often features a striking silver-gray coloration. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of pink, white, and purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are usually covered in fine, white hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This species is well adapted to dry, rocky soils and full sun exposure, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant ornamental plant.
